page.title: 15DODFORD FIRST SCHOOL
page.content: { Dodford First School}is a small village school with 55 pupils aged 5-9 years. It is Victorian red brick, built in 1877. The outside is quite ornate. It is a cross in plan. Many windows are arched, but some have been made square. The ceiling is high. Toilets and a kitchen have been added. There are three classrooms, one is very big. There are 3 teachers but one only comes in the morning. Some children have the same teacher for 2 years. There are not enough teachers to change every year. Dinner, music lessons and assembly take place in the large room. When it is cold or wet, P.E. is done in the classroom with the furniture stacked. The playground is small with bars and a climbing frame, and wild flowers grow on the bank. Most children come to school by car, one boy travels 12 miles.
